CARDINAL . As she received no reply to her request to purchase of the flat , on DATE the applicant , relying on section CARDINAL of ORG , brought a civil action in ORG ( PERSON ) against ORG seeking judgment in lieu of a contract of sale .
CARDINAL . The defendant submitted a counterclaim seeking the applicant ’s eviction .

CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings , on DATE ORG delivered a judgment whereby it dismissed the applicant ’s action . The court found that the applicant had been absent from the flat DATE and DATE , that is , for a period exceeding six months , and that her absence had not been justified . In so deciding the court followed the case - law of ORG ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL below ) , according to which , in cases where a third person moves into the flat , the bringing of legal proceedings in order to evict the occupant would demonstrate an intention to live in the flat and prevent the tenant ’s absence from being considered unjustified and resulting in a termination of the tenancy . However , the applicant had never instituted any proceedings to regain possession of her flat . Therefore , the condition for termination of her specially protected tenancy stipulated in section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW had already been met on DATE . CARDINAL of DATE and Rev-CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE ( see paragraphs CARDINAL below ) , that she had not been entitled to purchase the flat under ORG or to acquire the status of a protected lessee under LAW . CARDINAL .
